'''Melvin Terry Bullitt''' (born November 13, 1984 in [[Bryan, Texas]]) is an [[American football]] [[defensive back]] for the [[NFL]]'s [[Indianapolis Colts]].
==Early years== Bullitt starred at [[Naaman Forest High School]] in [[Garland, Texas]], where he was team MVP as a senior after totaling 78 tackles (43 solo), five pass deflections, and three interceptions. He also caught 7 passes for 185 yards and a touchdown.
Bullitt committed to Texas A&M at the end of his junior year.<ref name=11-24-08TribStar/>
==College career== As a freshman at [[Texas A&M Aggies football|Texas A&M]], Bullitt played in 8 games and produced 13 tackles. As a sophomore, he played in 12 games, finishing with 29 tackles, one interception, and one forced fumble. He started 10 games as a junior and compiled 59 tackles, two interceptions, and two forced fumbles. In the 2006 season, as a senior outside linebacker, he started in all 13 games had 84 tackles (26 solo), one interception, one fumble recovery, and eight pass deflections. After the season, he was named to the 2006 AT&T All-Big 12 Football First Team.<ref name=AllB12/> He finished his college career with 183 tackles (80 solo), 10.5 tackles for losses, and four interceptions.
Bullitt changed positions every season. He began playing at corner, then free safety, then strong safety, and finally at outside linebacker.<ref name=11-24-08TribStar>{{cite news|url=http://www.tribstar.com/sports/local_story_327220617.html?keyword=topstory|title=Bullitt enjoying role as Colts' closer}}</ref>
==Professional career== ===2007 season=== He signed with the [[Indianapolis Colts]] as an undrafted free agent.
He started in the Coltsâ dime package in a 33-14 week 5 victory over [[Tampa Bay Buccaneers|Tampa Bay]] and also saw action on defense in week 9 against [[New England Patriots|New England]] as a replacement for injured [[Pro Bowl]] safety [[Bob Sanders]]. He had his most extensive playing time in week 17 against [[Tennessee Titans|Tennessee]], when he entered the game in the second half after the Colts rested starters on both sides of the ball. Despite only playing the second half, he made a team-high 10 tackles.<ref>http://www.journalgazette.net/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20080921/SPORTS0605/809210428/-1/SPORTS</ref><ref>http://www.tribstar.com/sports/local_story_263234042.html</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.colts.com/sub.cfm?page=article7&news_id=43183d02-06f2-4631-9421-35625ea1eef2|title=Bullittâs Late Interception Clinches Colts Victory . . . Again}}</ref>
===2008 season=== During the 2008 season, Bullitt made three game-saving interceptions to seal victories for the Colts. In the 31â27 comeback win over the Texans on October 5, he intercepted a pass by quarterback [[Sage Rosenfels]] at the Indianapolis 22, with 42 seconds remaining in the game. On November 9, Steelers quarterback [[Ben Roethlisberger]] attempted to throw a touchdown pass into the end zone on the final play, but Bullitt intercepted the pass, preventing a Steelers comeback and sealing the 24â20 Colts win. The third game-saver occurred in the second matchup against the Texans on November 16, when Bullitt intercepted Rosenfels' pass at the Colts 35, with 32 seconds left in the game. In the same game, however, he missed a tackle near the line of scrimmage on running back [[Steve Slaton]], who ran 71 yards for a touchdown.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.news-sentinel.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20081122/SPORTS/811220314|title=Colts' Bullitt proves value as safety}}</ref> The Colts still won 33â27.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.star-telegram.com/329/story/1051517.html|title=Former Texas A&M safety Melvin Bullitt is making the big plays}}</ref><ref>http://www.news-sentinel.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20081122/SPORTS/811220314</ref> Overall, Bullitt started nine games during the season, recording 42 solo tackles and four interceptions.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.journalgazette.net/article/20090912/SPORTS0605/309129942/1008/SPORTS|title=Bullitt quickly makes his mark in secondary}}</ref>
After the season, Bullitt received recognition from ''[[USA Today]]'', which listed him on its annual [[USA Today All-Joe Team|"All-Joe" team]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.usatoday.com/sports/football/nfl/2009-01-20-all-joe-team_N.htm|title=Annual All-Joe team: Honoring those who won little acclaim | work=USA Today | first=Larry | last=Weisman | date=January 22, 2009 | accessdate=May 12, 2010}}</ref>
Regarding his then-new role as a starter, Bullitt stated: "You always want to be a starter. Thatâs why you come to the NFL. You donât want to come in and be a backup. You have to learn and you have to wait your time. You have to be patient, because anytime, an opportunity may come. Mine came this year, and I just wanted to go out and do the best I can and show people in the league I can play, too."<ref name=11-24-08TribStar/>
===2009 season=== In January 2009, Bullitt was named the "emerging star" of the [[AFC South]] by an [[ESPN.com]] blogger; seven other players representing each division of the league were named one as well. The players were picked based on their performances in the 2008 season.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://sports.espn.go.com/nfl/news/story?page=predictions09/nfl|title=Flacco, Ravens should soar to new heights in 2009}}</ref>
His teammates elected him as one of the two 2009 special teams captains.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.colts.com/sub.cfm?page=article7&news_id=a7a1c255-d0e4-450d-8b3b-7ba59ba4c53f|title= COLTS NAME FOUR CAPTAINS F0R 2009}}</ref> He started the season as a starter replacing the injured Bob Sanders. He was named the "Unsung Hero of the Week" for Week 3 by ''USA Today'' for his performance against the Arizona Cardinals. Bullitt forced a fumble and also prevented an airborne player from scoring a touchdown at the goal line.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.usatoday.com/sports/football/nfl/2009-09-28-nfl-replay_N.htm|title=NFL Replay: Declining skills at the root of T.O.'s slow start | work=USA Today | first=Jarrett | last=Bell | date=September 30, 2009 | accessdate=May 12, 2010}}</ref>
Bullitt also made a crucial fourth down stop in the 35â34 victory over the New England Patriots.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://sentinelsource.com/articles/2009/11/16/sports/national/free/id_379416.txt|title=They did what!?: Patriotsâ fourth-down gamble backfires big time}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://blogs.indystar.com/philb/2009/11/the_bullitt_shot_heard_around.html|title='The Bullitt Shot' heard around the NFL world}}</ref>
For the second straight year, Bullitt made [[USA Today]]'s [[USA Today All-Joe Team|"All-Joe" team]].<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.usatoday.com/sports/football/nfl/2010-01-26-all-joe-team_N.htm | work=USA Today | title=Joe Flacco an overachieving headliner on '09 All-Joe Team | first=Nate | last=Davis | date=January 28, 2010 | accessdate=May 12, 2010}}</ref>
===2010â2011 seasons=== In October 2010, Bullitt was placed on injured reserve and missed the rest of the season.<ref>http://profootballtalk.nbcsports.com/2010/10/05/colts-safety-melvin-bullitt-will-miss-the-rest-of-the-season/</ref>
Three weeks into the 2011 season, Bullitt was placed on injured reserve.<ref>http://www.1070thefan.com/news/story.aspx?ID=1566966</ref>
==Personal== He wears the No. 33 in honor of his father, Jerry Bullitt, who wore the number as a linebacker at Texas A&M. When asked about his number, Bullitt stated: "I kind of feel like when I'm wearing (No. 33), a piece of my dad is with me when I'm on the field." <ref>[http://www.indystar.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20080518/SPORTS03/805180377/1004/SPORTS Rhodes caught in a numbers game, and it might get costly IndyStar.com | The Indianapolis Star]</ref> Fellow teammate [[Dominic Rhodes]] previously wore the same number for six seasons from 2001â2006 before playing the 2007 season for the [[Oakland Raiders]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tribstar.com/colts/local_story_211223912.html|title=Dominic Rhodes enjoys reunion with team he helped win Super Bowl XLI}}</ref> Once Rhodes returned to the Colts prior to the 2008 season, he tried to get the number back and even offered Bullitt serious money for it, but to no avail.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://nfl.fanhouse.com/2008/05/18/back-with-the-colts-dominic-rhodes-might-buy-no-33-from-melvin/|title=Back With the Colts, Dominic Rhodes Might Buy No. 33 From Melvin Bullitt}}</ref>
